intro: Oldenlandia filicaulis, commonly known as the featherleaf spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. Oldenlandia filicaulis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and subtle floral display.
